Pledgie Donations

This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I am a proud member of RailsBridge, Helping new Rails developers get into our world and also contributed a few Patches to the Ruby on Rails core.

I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

Bag O' Links - 14/11/2009 /
name age history
Bag O' Links - 14/11/2009 14/11/2009 Another post [Elad Meidar]
  • noSQL Ecosystem – an article that make a little order in the recent ou-ha! around noSQL and the libraries around.
  • recurly – recurring payments to your application.
  • Creating Javascript custom events – this post form DailyJS explains how easy it is to bind and trigger custom events in jQuery.
  • Google’s issue tracker API – i wonder if the times in which we miss the Microsoft dominance over us are near. shakes
  • “Using ActionMailer for internal messaging” – simple tutorial that shows a very basic usage of AM.
  • Simply buttons v2 – CSS/javascript <button> awesomeness.
  • Starting Android development on your Mac – a brief tutorial for all of you infidels.
  • Unit testing: the easy way – the guys at the SD ruby group are sharing some insights.
  • How beautiful HTML looks like – Chris, you are awesome.
  • show_response for a better functional tests debugging – Neeraj with a sweet little tool to display the response in functional tests.
  • Using jQuery’s end() when building DOM elements – Another tip from Neeraj, who has a pretty neat blog.
  • Why do i need to use sudo when i install gems? – a discussion on Reddit explains why you probably don’t have to.
  • Great series of posts on Tokyo Tyrant – yes they are great, even more to come.
  • Scaling servers with amazong: CloudFront and Amazon S3 – looks like a series of posts is coming to life on Amazon’s services, i’ll be sure to follow.
  • Latency vs. Business – increase scalability, spend less money.
  • The basics of Javascript OOP – Just in time.
  • Gemcutter’s under-maintenance stack explained – rack + sinatra. nice.
  • Ruby Design patterns code samples" – from the book carrying the same title.

Treasures

  • rails_best_practices – rails_best_practices is a gem to check quality of rails app files according to ihower’s presentation from Kungfu RailsConf in Shanghai China
  • jaml – javascript HAML.
  • emile – emile.js is a no-thrills stand-alone CSS animation JavaScript framework, named after Émile Cohl, early animator.
  • shoulda-addons – Awesome add-ons to make Shoulda more awesome.
  • fitter_happier – A Rails Plugin for adding a simple health check to your application (note: i’d use metal for that).
  • Naive Bayes – Simple Naive Bayes classifier
  • Rack Streaming proxy – Streaming proxy for Rack, the rainbows to Rack::Proxy’s unicorn
